00048 /*****************************************************************************\
00049  *      File:   md.h
00050  *
00051  *      Description: Header file for the interface to the internal 
00052  *                   representation of the IMPACT Meta-Description Language
00053  *
00054  *      Creation Date:  March 1995
00055  *
00056  *      Authors: John C. Gyllenhaal and Wen-mei Hwu
00057  *
00058  *      Revisions:
00059  *           Shail Aditya (HP Labs) February 1996
00060  *           Changed MD_get_xxx() arguments to be consistent with MD_set_xxx()
00061  *           Added MD_num_xxx() which returns number of sections, entries, etc.
00062  *
00063  *           John C. Gyllenhaal  May 1996
00064  *           Folded Shail's changes back into IMPACT's version
00065  *           Changed low-level representation to use hex for integers
00066  *           Added MD_rename_entry(), MD_delete_element(), MD_max_field_index()
00067  *                 MD_max_element_index(), and MD_print_md_declarations()
00068  *           Changed all error messages to uniformly use MD_punt()
00069  * 
00070  *           John C. Gyllenhaal July 1996
00071  *           Implemented Shail Aditya's suggestion of adding void pointers to
00072  *           MD_Section and MD_Entry for the user's use.  Added functions
00073  *           MD_set_section_ext(), MD_get_section_ext(), MD_set_entry_ext(), 
00074  *           and MD_get_entry_ext().
00075  *
00076  *           John C. Gyllenhaal January 1998
00077  *           Implemented Marie Conte's and Andy Trick's suggestion of adding
00078  *           a new data type 'BLOCK' to allow an user to specify a block
00079  *           of binary data the same way ints, doubles, strings, and links
00080  *           are specified in fields.  (User readable input/output 
00081  *           respresents this data as a hex string.  Note that this data type
00082  *           may not make sense to programs running on different platforms or
00083  *           compiled with different compilers!)
00084  *           Also, switched to internal version of strdup (MD_strdup) in order 
00085  *           to handle 'out of memory' errors more gracefully.
00086  *
00087  * *
00088 \*****************************************************************************/
00089 
00090 #ifndef MD2_H
00091 #define MD2_H
00092 
00093 /* 10/29/02 REK Adding config.h */
00094 #ifdef HAVE_CONFIG_H
00095 #include <config.h>
00096 #endif
00097 /* Stdio.h needed for prototypes */
00098 #include <stdio.h>
00099 
00100 /*
00101  * MD data types supported. 
00102  * (Use defines instead of enum to allow fitting into short int
00103  *  in MD_Element)
00104  */
00105 #define MD_INT          1
00106 #define MD_DOUBLE       2
00107 #define MD_STRING       3
00108 #define MD_LINK         4
00109 #define MD_BLOCK        5
00110 
00111 /* Field types supported */
00112 typedef enum MD_FIELD_TYPE
00113 {
00114     MD_REQUIRED_FIELD   = 1,
00115     MD_OPTIONAL_FIELD   = 2
00116 } MD_FIELD_TYPE;
00117 
00118 /* Used as index to declare optional element types */
00119 #define MD_OPTIONAL_ELEMENTS    -1
00120 
00121 
00122 /* Symbol table used for database section, entry, and field names.
00123  * Internal use only!  Not designed to be used by non-MD functions!
00124  */
00125 typedef struct MD_Symbol
00126 {
00127     char                        *name;          /* Not a copy! */
00128     unsigned int                hash_val;       /* Hashed value of name */
00129     void                        *data;          /* a MD_xxx structure */
00130     struct MD_Symbol_Table      *table;         /* For deletion of symbol */
00131     struct MD_Symbol            *next_hash;     /* For table's hash table */
00132     struct MD_Symbol            *prev_hash;
00133     struct MD_Symbol            *next_symbol;   /* For table's contents list */
00134     struct MD_Symbol            *prev_symbol;
00135     int                         symbol_id;      /* Used by MD_write_md */
00136 
00137 } MD_Symbol;
00138 
00139 typedef struct MD_Symbol_Table
00140 {
00141     struct MD           *md;            /* For error messages */
00142     char                *name;          /* For error messages */
00143     MD_Symbol           **hash;         /* Array of size hash_size */
00144     int                 hash_size;      /* Must be power of 2 */
00145     int                 hash_mask;      /* AND mask, (hash_size - 1) */
00146     int                 resize_size;    /* When reached, resize hash table */
00147     MD_Symbol           *head_symbol;   /* Contents list */
00148     MD_Symbol           *tail_symbol;
00149     int                 symbol_count;
00150 } MD_Symbol_Table;
00151 
00152 /* Types to fill out later */
00153 
00154 typedef struct MD
00155 {
00156     char                *name;          /* Name of MD */
00157     MD_Symbol_Table     *section_table; /* Sections in the MD */
00158 } MD;
00159 
00160 typedef struct MD_Section
00161 {
00162     MD                  *md;              /* MD that section is in */
00163     char                *name;            /* Name of section */
00164     MD_Symbol_Table     *field_decl_table;/* Field declared in the section */
00165     MD_Symbol_Table     *entry_table;     /* Entries in the section */
00166     int                 max_field_index;  /* Index of the max declared field */
00167     struct MD_Field_Decl **field_decl;    /* Array of field decl pointers */
00168     int                 field_array_size; /* Size of above field_decl array */
00169                                           /* and Entry's field array */
00170     MD_Symbol           *symbol;          /* In MD's section_table */
00171     void                *user_ext;        /* For user's use, NULL initially */
00172 }
00173  MD_Section;
00174 
00175 typedef struct MD_Element_Req
00176 {
00177     struct MD_Field_Decl *field_decl;   /* Field decl that element_req is in */
00178     int                 require_index;  /* Index in field_decl->require array*/
00179     short               type;           /* Type of element required */
00180     char                *desc;          /* Description (for error messages) */
00181     int                 kleene_starred; /* 1 if kleene_starred */
00182     MD_Section          **link;         /* Array of section pointers */
00183     int                 link_array_size;/* Size/links in above link array */
00184 } MD_Element_Req;
00185 
00186 typedef struct MD_Field_Decl
00187 {
00188     MD_Section          *section;           /* Section that field decl is in */
00189     int                 field_index;        /* Index in entry->field array*/
00190     char                *name;              /* Name of field being declared */
00191     MD_FIELD_TYPE       type;               /* Type of field being declared */
00192     int                 max_require_index;  /* Index of last requirement */
00193     MD_Element_Req      **require;          /* Decls of element requirements */
00194     int                 require_array_size; /* Size of above require array */
00195     MD_Element_Req      *kleene_starred_req;/* NULL if no req starred */
00196     MD_Symbol           *symbol;            /* In section->field_decl_table */
00197 } MD_Field_Decl;
00198 
00199 /* 
00200  * Each entry has an array of pointers to fields (of size field_size).
00201  * The pointers in the field array will be NULL for unspecified fields.
00202  */
00203 typedef struct MD_Entry
00204 {
00205     MD_Section          *section;       /* Section that entry is in */
00206     char                *name;          /* Name of entry */
00207     struct MD_Field     **field;        /* Array of field pointers, */
00208                                         /* of size section->field_array_size */
00209     MD_Symbol           *symbol;        /* In MD_Section's entry_table */
00210     void                *user_ext;      /* For user's use, NULL initially */
00211 } MD_Entry;
00212 
00213 
00214 /* The block respresentation used in MD_Element (designed to fit in 8 bytes).
00215  * Use macro interface routines for MD_Element for acessing data.
00216  */
00217 typedef struct MD_Block
00218 {
00219     unsigned int        size;           /* Size of block, may be zero */
00220     void                *ptr;           /* Pointer to block, NULL if size = 0*/
00221 } MD_Block;
00222 
00223 /* The data in the database.  
00224  * Use macro interface routines for accessing data.
00225  */
00226 typedef struct MD_Element
00227 {
00228     struct MD_Field     *field;         /* Field element is in */
00229     unsigned short      element_index;  /* index in field->element */
00230     short               type;           /* The type of data accessed */
00231     union                               
00232     {
00233         int             i;              /* INT value */
00234         double          d;              /* DOUBLE value */
00235         char            *s;             /* STRING value */
00236         MD_Entry        *l;             /* LINK value */
00237         MD_Block        b;              /* BLOCK value */
00238     } value;
00239 } MD_Element;
00240 
00241 /*
00242  * Each field has an array of pointers to elements (of size array_size).
00243  * max_index is the index of the last element set to a value, -1 if
00244  * no elements have been set.
00245  * The pointers in element array will be NULL for unspecified elements.
00246  */
00247 typedef struct MD_Field
00248 {
00249     MD_Entry            *entry;            /* Entry that field is in */
00250     MD_Field_Decl       *decl;             /* Declaration of field contents */
00251     int                 max_element_index; /* max_index of last set element */
00252     MD_Element          **element;         /* Pointers to elements in field */
00253     int                 element_array_size;/* Size of above element array */
00254 } MD_Field;
00255 
00256

00258  * MD prototypes/macros declarations
00259  */

00291                       MD_Section *section);

00293                                    int element_index, int section_array_size,
00294                                    MD_Section **section_array);

00296                                         int element_index);
00297

00299 extern void MD_rename_entry (MD_Entry *entry, char *new_name);
00300

00304 extern MD_Entry *MD_prev_entry (MD_Entry *entry);

00307                                int num_elements);

00310 extern void MD_delete_element (MD_Field *field, int index);
00311

00333 
00334 /* 
00335  * MD macros.
00336  * Two versions available:
00337  *  1) macro replaced with code optimized for speed.
00338  *  2) macro replaced with function call version and some function calls
00339  *     changed to perform extra error checking on arguments, etc..
00340  *
00341  *  Version 2 is provided to aid debugging macro arguments and to test
00342  *  for subtle data type mismatches.
00343  */
00344 #ifndef MD_DEBUG_MACROS
00345 
00346 #define MD_num_sections(md)             ((md)->section_table->symbol_count)
00347 #define MD_find_section(md, name) \
00348             ((MD_Section *)_MD_find_symbol_data((md)->section_table, name))
00349 
00350 
00351 #define MD_delete_section(section) \
00352             (MD_delete_symbol(((MD_Section *)(section))->symbol, \
00353                               (void (*)(void *))_MD_free_section))
00354 
00355 #define MD_num_entries(section)         ((section)->entry_table->symbol_count)
00356 
00357 #define MD_find_entry(section, name) \
00358             ((MD_Entry *)_MD_find_symbol_data((section)->entry_table, name))
00359 
00360 #define MD_delete_entry(entry) \
00361             (MD_delete_symbol(((MD_Entry *)(entry))->symbol, \
00362                               (void (*)(void *))_MD_free_entry))
00363 
00364 #define MD_num_field_decls(section) \
00365             ((section)->field_decl_table->symbol_count)
00366 
00367 #define MD_max_field_index(section)     ((section)->max_field_index)
00368 
00369 #define MD_find_field_decl(section, name) \
00370           ((MD_Field_Decl *)_MD_find_symbol_data((section)->field_decl_table, \
00371                                                  name))
00372 
00373 #define MD_find_field(entry, field_decl) \
00374             ((entry)->field[(field_decl)->field_index])
00375 
00376 #define MD_num_elements(field)          ((field)->max_element_index + 1)
00377 #define MD_max_element_index(field)     ((field)->max_element_index)
00378 
00379 #define MD_set_int(field, index, value) _MD_set_int(field, index, value)
00380 #define MD_get_int(field, index)        ((field)->element[index]->value.i)
00381 
00382 #define MD_set_double(field, index, value) _MD_set_double(field, index, value)
00383 #define MD_get_double(field, index)     ((field)->element[index]->value.d)
00384 
00385 #define MD_set_string(field, index, value) _MD_set_string(field, index, value)
00386 #define MD_get_string(field, index)     ((field)->element[index]->value.s)
00387 
00388 #define MD_set_block(field, index, size, ptr) \
00389             _MD_set_block(field, index, size, ptr)
00390 #define MD_get_block_size(field, index) \
00391             ((field)->element[index]->value.b.size)
00392 #define MD_get_block_ptr(field, index) \
00393             ((field)->element[index]->value.b.ptr)
00394 
00395 #define MD_set_link(field, index, value) _MD_set_link(field, index, value)
00396 #define MD_get_link(field, index)       ((field)->element[index]->value.l)
00397 
00398 #define MD_set_section_ext(section, ext) ((section)->user_ext = (void *)(ext))
00399 #define MD_get_section_ext(section)     ((section)->user_ext)
00400 
00401 #define MD_set_entry_ext(entry, ext)    ((entry)->user_ext = (void *)(ext))
00402 #define MD_get_entry_ext(entry)         ((entry)->user_ext)
00403 
00404 #else
00405 
00406 #define MD_num_sections(md)             _MD_num_sections(md)
00407 #define MD_find_section(md, name)       _MD_find_section(md, name)
00408 #define MD_delete_section(section)      _MD_delete_section(section)
00409 
00410 #define MD_num_entries(section)         _MD_num_entries(section)

00412 #define MD_delete_entry(entry)          _MD_delete_entry(entry)
00413 
00414

00418

00420

00423 
00424 #define MD_set_int(field, index, value) \
00425             _MD_set_int_type_checking(field, index, value)
00426 #define MD_get_int(field, index)        _MD_get_int(field, index)
00427 
00428 #define MD_set_double(field, index, value) \
00429             _MD_set_double_type_checking(field, index, value)
00430 #define MD_get_double(field, index)     _MD_get_double(field, index)
00431 
00432 #define MD_set_string(field, index, value) \
00433             _MD_set_string_type_checking(field, index, value)

00435 
00436 #define MD_set_block(field, index, size, ptr) \

00439 #define MD_get_block_ptr(field, index)  _MD_get_block_ptr(field, index)
00440 
00441 #define MD_set_link(field, index, value) \
00442             _MD_set_link_type_checking(field, index, value)
00443 #define MD_get_link(field, index)       _MD_get_link(field, index)
00444 
00445 #define MD_set_section_ext(section, ext) \
00446             _MD_set_section_ext(section, (void *)(ext))
00447 #define MD_get_section_ext(section)     _MD_get_section_ext(section)
00448 
00449 #define MD_set_entry_ext(entry, ext)    _MD_set_entry_ext(entry, (void *)(ext))
00450 #define MD_get_entry_ext(entry)         _MD_get_entry_ext(entry)
00451 
00452 
00453 #endif

00455 /* MD checking macros (only one version available) */

00457              _MD_check_section(out, section, "MD_check_section")
00458 #define MD_check_entry(out, entry) \
00459              _MD_check_entry(out, entry, "MD_check_entry")
00460 #define MD_check_field(out, field) \
00461              _MD_check_field(out, field, "MD_check_field")
